Posted By: SleetFox (7/2/2011 11:46:08 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I love this card so much.  
Unless it's one of those topdeck-something-good-or-lose situations(in which 95% of a deck is useless anyway), it's at worst a rod(counter, permanent-removal or of attention, whichever you wish). No one wants to leave it on the table. You have people forgetting that they're dying thanks to the various burn spells you have in favour of paying attention to the counters building up.  
If it doesn't get removed, it wins the game. If it gets removed, you're a RDW, you don't care, just bolt the guy or something. It's also situationally great, since it can get rid of firewalkers, baneslayers, emrakul, whatever it is you're facing. Though it is a bit sad to have that much damage wasted on a creature rather than the opponent.  
  
Also, it works great with non-red spells which belong in a red deck(like Tezzy's Gambit). Definitely the star of the red summer.

If it doesn't get removed, it wins the game. If it gets removed, you're a RDW, you don't care, just bolt the guy or something. It's also situationally great, since it can get rid of firewalkers, baneslayers, emrakul, whatever it is you're facing. Though it is a bit sad to have that much damage wasted on a creature rather than the opponent.

Also, it works great with non-red spells which belong in a red deck(like Tezzy's Gambit). Definitely the star of the red summer.

Posted By: Worldwalker1 (5/16/2011 11:55:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Probably the second strongest of the cycle.  
  
The Shrines have a tendency to just sit in the corner and be forgotten, and then all of a sudden your opponent looks over and is like "Oh, hey, that's a 12 damage cannon pointed at my face."   
  
It's great in a Limited pool even if you're not running red, since it upticks every turn regardless, so it's a good source of a lot of damage. If you can drop this turn 2 and chip away for 5-6 turns, you're liable to have enough counters on here to blow them off the face of the earth. Or Mirrodin, as it were.
posts.html:

Posted By: IUHoosier (9/10/2011 6:42:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This can get out of hand even more quickly with the introduction of [Chandra, the Firebrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra, the Firebrand). Copy proliferate spells with her -2 (preferably [Volt Charge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volt Charge)) and watch the counters stack up on your Shrine. Chandra doesn't even lose loyalty since she gains 2 loyalty counters – unless, of course, she was already or gets brought down to 2 before the spells resolve.  
  
Looks like it will go particularly well in UR Counterburn between Chandra doubling the nice proliferate spells and [Negate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Negate)/[Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak) to keep your shrine from getting hit with [Into the Roil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Into the Roil) or [Shatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shatter) (and of course to keep you in control of the game).  
  
(Update)  
Looking at the Innistrad spoilers thus far, we can expect this card to get along nicely with Flashback since the text on flashback has been oracled to specifically say "cast." So you can use [Devil's Play](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Devil's Play) to [Blaze/auto](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blaze/auto)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This can get out of hand even more quickly with the introduction of Chandra, the Firebrand. Copy proliferate spells with her -2 (preferably Volt Charge) and watch the counters stack up on your Shrine. Chandra doesn't even lose loyalty since she gains 2 loyalty counters – unless, of course, she was already or gets brought down to 2 before the spells resolve.

Looks like it will go particularly well in UR Counterburn between Chandra doubling the nice proliferate spells and Negate/Mana Leak to keep your shrine from getting hit with Into the Roil or Shatter (and of course to keep you in control of the game).

(Update)
Looking at the Innistrad spoilers thus far, we can expect this card to get along nicely with Flashback since the text on flashback has been oracled to specifically say "cast." So you can use Devil's Play to Blaze/auto... (see all)

posts.post_content:
This is both powerful, and wonderfully skill-testing.
  
   
Opening eight: Mountain x3, [Goblin Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Guide), [Ember Hauler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ember Hauler), [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt), [Goblin Grenade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Grenade), Shrine of Burning Rage. What would you play on your 2nd turn?
  
   
What if instead of Bolt you have [Goblin Chieftain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Chieftain)? [Goblin Bushwacker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Bushwacker)? A fourth Mountain or a second Shrine? Does it matter which colors your opponent is playing?
posts.html:
This is both powerful, and wonderfully skill-testing.

Opening eight: Mountain x3, Goblin Guide, Ember Hauler, Lightning Bolt, Goblin Grenade, Shrine of Burning Rage. What would you play on your 2nd turn?

What if instead of Bolt you have Goblin Chieftain? Goblin Bushwacker? A fourth Mountain or a second Shrine? Does it matter which colors your opponent is playing?
